title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader's 2018 Ford F-150 requires a plastic oil pan replacement for the third time under warranty.
A metal oil pan for the F-150 is available for $200 but requires extra labor and isn't covered by warranty.
Vehicle design issues are common, with complex repairs like Ford Explorer's water pump and buried thermostats in some GM engines.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Kayshon Boutte, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Garrett Bradbury missed Wednesday practice due to injuries.
Boutte's absence affects Patriots' deep threat capability; rookie Kyle Williams may fill in against Buccaneers.
Patriots prepare for Buccaneers game without key players; rookie TreVeyon Henderson expected to step up.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, 31, a coach at Boston Athletic Academy, charged with felony for allegedly trafficking over 10 grams of fentanyl.
Mejia was arrested after allegedly selling fentanyl to an undercover Boston police officer on October 19.
He pled not guilty at his arraignment and was released on personal recognizance; next court date set for December 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group, an edtech firm, will close its Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati offices to adopt a fully remote model.
The company's Boston spaces at 3 Center Plaza and 200 Pier 4 Blvd in the Seaport District will be closed.
Cengage has nearly 4,000 employees and serves about 90 million students across 125 countries with digital products.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: 41 Patriots players worked out on their day off, a move praised by head coach Mike Vrabel.
The workout session took place at the team's Gillette Stadium facility, showing dedication despite their day off.
Vrabel cited the off-day workout as evidence of the team's commitment, beyond their current 7-2 record.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, were found dead on Colonial Drive in Beverly, Massachusetts.
The incident is being investigated as an apparent murder-suicide by local police and the Essex County DA's office.
Both victims were pronounced dead at the scene with gunshot wounds; the investigation involves state and local authorities.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, 65, was sentenced to 15 years for two manslaughter charges related to 1984 and 1993 killings.
Lewis was linked to gangster James "Whitey" Bulger and accepted manslaughter plea bargains to avoid murder trials.
The resolution closed cold cases for the killings of Brian Watson and William Villani, providing closure to families.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox have resources to pursue a trade for Tigers pitcher Tarik Skubal, per ESPN's Buster Olney.
Skubal, 28, won 2024 AL Cy Young and led AL in ERA and WHIP during the 2025 season.
Skubal set to become a free agent after 2026; Red Sox could retain him long-term with a substantial contract.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge halted the installation of two 10-foot statues of patron saints outside Quincy's new public safety building.
PETA offered to help fund the statues if Quincy adds a statue of St. Francis, the patron saint of animals.
The ACLU filed a lawsuit against Quincy over the statues, citing their religious nature and lack of transparency.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praised Patriots QB Drake Maye's performance, noting his key role in the team's 7-2 record.
Drake Maye is completing 74.1% of passes, with 2,285 yards and 17 touchdowns; ranked third in MVP odds.
Belichick warned New England to guard against sophomore slumps, citing Washington's recent struggles as a cautionary tale.
